review: I bought this as a wedding gift for my girl, because she'd been hinting about wanting one. She's into tech stuff and gadgets and anything with an Apple logo on it, so she loves it. I like it too, but I have issues with it.There's only a couple of things I don't like about this, causing it to get a 3-star rating instead of 5 stars.For one thing, it has an app for Netflix and Hulu, but it has no app for Amazon's Instant Video. Granted, you can stream Amazon content from an iPhone, but it's annoying to have to do that. If my wife didn't automatically assume everything by Apple is the best, I'd have just bought a Roku device because that'll also play Amazon video.The other complaint is the tiny remote. I'm sure Apple-lovers are all swooning over how sleek and stylish it looks, but the remote is just entirely too tiny for my tastes. It gets lost every other day, because it's just so tiny. It's about as thick as a graham cracker, and it's very short and narrow. So it's always being buried and hidden under clutter, or it's always falling into cracks in the couches/recliners. I know it's unheard of for people to ask for bigger electronic devices, but it would actually be appreciated to have a conventionally-sized remote that won't get lost all the time. Frankly, having a bigger remote would allow for programmable shortcut buttons or a small qwerty keyboard which would make the Apple TV even easier to use.
